summary:
DESCRIPTION
Adds a fort named Fort Buldurr to the Rift region that can be utilized as a player house. The fort is rustic and is designed to look like an adventurer\'s home rather than the home of a town citizen.
descriptionHtml:
[size=+2]This mod is basically dead, at least for now.  Sorry.[/size]
[color=red]TheDarkListener34 and raventrigun have permission to edit, update, and upload this mod anywhere and whenever they want.[/color]

DESCRIPTION
Adds a fort named Fort Buldurr to the Rift region that can be utilized as a player house. The fort is rustic and is designed to look like an adventurer\'s home rather than the home of a town citizen. I have tested this mod myself quite a bit and I do not think there are any issues, but I may have overlooked something.  PLEASE LEAVE A COMMENT IF YOU FIND A PROBLEM. Also, please endorse it if you like it or not so that I know whether I should publish something like this again.  See comments section for discussion of this mod.

*NOTE*
This mod was first published on Steam Workshop.  The change log below includes record of updates from before uploading to the Nexus on Feb 20th 2012.

CHANGE LOG
v0.1 - Initial release Feb 15th 2012. Fully decorated, optimized, and navmeshed.
v0.2 - Added pet dog to interior of fort. Feb 15th 2012
v0.3 - Made lighting brighter, added 2 more bookshelves to \"dining\" room. Feb 16th 2012
v0.4 - Added mannequins, dog is now named \"Dog\" and roams the fort more than before, dog does not have conversation options for following anymore due to problems, fixed a couple lighting issues, navmesh outside fort is a bit better, but still has issues I cannot solve. Feb 18th 2012
v0.5 - Uploaded dungeon expansion. Access through trapdoor in main fort stairway room. Feb 20th 2012
NEWEST - v0.6 - Fixed exterior navmesh.  Should be completely functional. Also added 2 unique books.  One is \"Buldurr\'s Tale\" and it simply thanks you for checking out this mod.  The other is \"The Cask of Amontillado\" by Edgar Allan Poe, and I added it because it is a short story that I love  Feb 21st 2012

LOCATION
The fort is located northeast of the Ruins of Bthalft.
The map marker is visible immediately upon starting a new game, but you will have to discover it before you can fast travel to it. Alternatively, you can use the console to \"teleport\" to the interior of the fort or the fort dungeon at any time. In the console, type \"coc fortbuldurr\" or \"coc fortbuldurrdungeon\" You can do this without discovering the fort, walk outside the fort, and it will become discovered so you can fast travel from then on.

FEATURES
Weapon and shield racks
2 unique books
Pet dog
Mannequins
Big mannequins
Even bigger mannequins
Display cases
Safe with lock
Bookshelves
Alchemy and Enchanting tables
Player owned beds
Player owned chests
Shelves and tables to decorate
Guard barracks
Dungeon
Surprise suit of armor scattered throughout dungeon!
Interior fully navmeshed

COMING SOON
Dungeon will have access to cave system leading to tall tower that is visible from exterior of fort!
Secret rooms!
Quest to obtain ownership of the fort!
Purchase optional upgrades such as...
- personal guards to defend the fort
- better lighting
- remove rubble and broken down pieces of fort
- upgrade to noble furniture
- other stuff being brainstormed constantly
Other stuff we might think of
Comment with any suggestions you have

CREDITS
-Bethesda for developing Skyrim
-BIG thank you to raventrigun for helping with dialogue and quest aspects of this mod in order to make it fit better into Skyrim, and for being such a great supporter of this mod since the day it was published.
-Edgar Allan Poe for publishing The Cask of Amontillado a long time ago so that it is legal for me to add it as a book in this mod.

USAGE PERMISSION
Message me if you want permission to edit this mod.
author: bobrockstar

files.name: FortBuldurr0_6
files.changelogHtml:
Fixed exterior navmesh. Should be completely functional.
Also added 2 unique books. One is \"Buldurr\'s Tale\" and it simply thanks you for checking out this mod. The other is \"The Cask of Amontillado\" by Edgar Allan Poe
I added it because it is a short story that I love and the story will soon be a clue (if you read it) to help you find a secret area in Fort Buldurr! :) Feb 21st 2012
